definition: To exclude or suppress certain elements or information from one's perception or attention, typically in the context of focusing on specific aspects or disregarding distractions. This term is commonly employed in the field of user interface design, where it refers to the action of hiding or removing unnecessary or less relevant elements to enhance user experience.

examples.english: I'm trying to tune out the noise.

examples.german: Er konnte die störenden Gedanken ausblenden.
examples.english: He was able to block out the disturbing thoughts.

examples.german: Die Werbung blendet oft wichtige Informationen aus.
Es ist wichtig, negative Einflüsse auszublenden.
examples.english: It is important to filter out negative influences.

examples.german: Sie versuchte, die Kritik auszublenden und sich auf ihre Arbeit zu konzentrieren.
examples.english: She tried to ignore the criticism and focus on her work.
